alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 27 at 11:07AM MST until December 29 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet with locally higher amounts across the west and southwest facing slopes. Winds gusting as high as 60 to 70 mph causing considerable blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Eastern San Juan Mountains above 10000 Feet and the eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Feet. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Continuous snow with several rounds of heavier snow will impact the area through the period. The heaviest snow will fall this afternoon through tonight and again Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. Although snow will fall lighter at times, strong winds and widespread blowing snow will keep travel conditions hazardous.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft
